content:
You've got a great plan shaping up!

Millennium Park and Navy Pier are both fantastic choices in Chicago. You'll have a blast taking in the sights and sounds of the city. Make sure to take a stroll through the beautiful Lurie Garden in Millennium Park, and don't miss the free outdoor concerts and events they often host.

In Denver, the Denver Art Museum is an amazing cultural attraction, and Larimer Square is a great spot to explore for shopping, dining, and people-watching. You'll find plenty of unique boutiques, art galleries, and restaurants to discover.

When it comes to craft beer, Denver is a paradise! You'll have no shortage of options to try. Some popular craft breweries in the city include:

* Great Divide Brewing Co.: Known for their Yeti Imperial Stout and other robust beers.
* Odell Brewing Co.: Offers a wide range of beer styles, from IPAs to stouts and sours.
* Wynkoop Brewing Co.: Colorado's oldest brewpub, serving up everything from lagers to porters.
* Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project: Focuses on wild and sour beers, with a great selection of barrels and bottles.
* TRVE Brewing Co.: A metal-inspired brewery with a wide range of beer styles and a fun atmosphere.

Be sure to check out online reviews and ratings to find the best fit for your tastes. You might also consider taking a brewery tour or joining a beer-themed event to make the most of your craft beer experience.

Now, I have to ask: Are you planning on meeting up with Rachel and Chris at any of these spots, or do you have other plans with them?
